rev.comment: restore consensus lede of Sept 20, removing factually incorrect IP edits
Rm dup cats (WP check error 17) and/or general cleanup using [[Project:AutoWikiBrowser|AWB]]
Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/80.25.131.231|80.25.131.231]] to last revision by Bandurist ([[WP:HG|HG]])
changed from Jewishreligion to Jewish religion
/* Usage */ If we are to take Wikipedia seriously, make sure you understand the purpose of language. By making stuff up, it just makes you look bad. "Semetic" is a race, not "Jewish."
The meaning of "Anti" and "Semite" are clearly defined within the English dictionary. The word Jewish refers to someone's religion. Hebrew is to be "Semite" the original race of the Jewish people.
Photo is not relevant to article; please maintain a [[:WP:NPOV|neutral point of view]] when editing this sensitive article

This is my original sentence, it is been published again and again even though it is gramatically wrong. If you want to alter it, do, but do not simply repost the former lingual freak.
Referencing it here gives undue weight to a single study. It's significant enough to be *part of* the debate around "NAS", but it's not any sort of definitive statement.
These article *are* suitable for Wikipedia, and I've kept them on the NAS page, but I don't believe they're significant enough to mention in this context.
